title: Chargers pull ahead in OT to defeat Eagles in tight MNF win
content: It was the biggest win of the season for a Chargers team that appeared to be spiraling out of playoff contention.

title: Hurts has 2 turnovers on 1 play amid 4-INT night
content: Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts became the first player since 1978 -- as far back as research goes -- to commit two turnovers on the same play during Monday night's overtime loss to the Chargers.

title: Sources: Ailing Colts to work out retired QB Rivers
content: The Indianapolis Colts will work out retired quarterback Philip Rivers on Tuesday, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: 4 LSU coaches rejoin Rebels for CFP run
content: Sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Monday that four current LSU offensive assistants are joining offensive coordinator Charlie Weis Jr. at Ole Miss to help prepare the Rebels for their College Football Playoff appearance, which begins Dec. 20 vs. Tulane.

title: Notre Dame AD: ACC caused 'permanent damage'
content: Notre Dame's AD ripped the ACC after its CFP snub, saying the conference that houses almost every Fighting Irish team has caused "permanent damage" to the relationship.

title: Mendoza, Pavia, Love, Sayin in Heisman's final 4
content: After leading Indiana to its first Big Ten title in 58 years, Fernando Mendoza was announced as a Heisman Trophy finalist Monday, joining Vanderbilt quarterback Diego Pavia, Notre Dame running back Jeremiyah Love and Ohio State quarterback Julian Sayin.

title: Sources: Gamecocks hiring TCU's Briles as OC
content: South Carolina is finalizing a deal to hire TCU's Kendal Briles as the school's new offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Monday.

title: Harper spoils Queen's triple-double in rookie clash
content: Dylan Harper came out on top in a clash of 2025 rookies despite Pelicans center Derik Queen's 33-point triple-double in a thrilling 135-132 Spurs win.

title: Source: Bucs signing OLB Pierre-Paul after tryout
content: Veteran pass rusher Jason Pierre-Paul is signing with the Buccaneers on their practice squad after trying out for the team Monday, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Barnwell sorts through NFL playoff race chaos: Are the Colts, Chiefs and Ravens finished?
content: Daniel Jones' injury, the Ravens' red zone woes, the Bears' defensive mistakes and the Chiefs' drop issues meant big changes in the race for the postseason.

title: What do Week 14 games mean for the rest of the season?
content: Our reporters react to the action, answering lingering questions and detailing what you need to know.

title: Will Daniel Jones start for the Colts in '26? Is the front office safe? Key questions for Indy
content: Will coach Shane Steichen and GM Chris Ballard survive a late-season freefall? What's next at QB in Indy?

title: Wetzel: Relax, the CFP selection process is (mostly) working
content: Don't overreact to this year's playoff rankings by blowing up the system. Chasing perfection is a fool's errand.

title: CFP Anger Index: An absurd farce over Notre Dame, Miami
content: Evaluating the committee's ranking process, and what teams should be most upset about in final CFP ranking.

title: Everything we know about the Heat's trade for Terry Rozier -- and whether he could be dealt again
content: Terry Rozier, who is scheduled to be arraigned Monday for his alleged role in a betting scheme, was traded to Miami in 2024 without any investigation being disclosed.

title: The NHL's best this week: Terry Ryan and hockey dreams
content: From first-round draft pick to iconic character, Ryan's path is a unique one. Plus, this week's key NHL games.

title: MLB winter meetings updates, rumors and predictions: The latest buzz from Orlando
content: From predicting who will sign to the latest buzz from Florida, here's everything you need as baseball's hot stove season heats up.

title: Who has the most travel at 2026 World Cup? And why does it matter?
content: For many national teams, how they handle and recover from extensive travel could make or break their World Cup next summer.

title: Men: New No. 1 after Purdue's shock loss
content: The fifth in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what's next for every team in the ranking.

title: How each of the 12 College Football Playoff teams could win the national title
content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

title: Free agents: Trevor Lawrence and Packers WRs among top options
content: All the free agent options worth adding as we look dive into Week 15 and the fantasy football playoffs.

title: Buzz: Etienne, Pollard and Godwin among players who were getting the ball on Sunday
content: Eric Moody's notebook highlights participation and usage trends that drove fantasy highs and lows on Sunday

title: What we know so far about Mo Salah's Liverpool future
content: One of the world's best players, Mohamed Salah looks set to leave Liverpool soon after venting his frustration at being benched. But what does the future hold for him?

title: In winning F1 title, Norris proves himself (and his doubters) wrong
content: Lando Norris doubted himself as a title contender earlier this year. Now, as the curtain falls on the F1 season, he can call himself a world champion.

title: Week 14 only added more chaos to the NFL playoff race -- "a bookmaker's dream"
content: Week 14 "set the tone" for many NFL teams as Super Bowl favorites faltered and underdogs picked up steam.

title: Early Week 15 bets: Patriots over Bills, Lions to cover in shootout with Rams
content: What lines offered value once odds came out? Here are five games we're eyeing for bets going into Week 15.

title: QBs Cam Ward, Shedeur Sanders swap jerseys after Titans' victory
content: The Browns and Titans rookies exchanged comical trash talk while swapping jerseys following Tennessee's 31-29 win at Cleveland.

title: Pickups: Ryan Nembhard, Quentin Grimes among players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: UFC 323 fight grades: Why Dvalishvili-Yan wasn't the best fight on the card
content: Which fights were the best and worst of the last UFC PPV of 2025? Andreas Hale grades every fight from UFC 323.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Man United target Lille's Bouaddi
content: Lille midfielder Ayyoub Bouaddi has attracted the attention of Real Madrid and other big clubs. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Centre Orders IndiGo To Reduce Flights By 5%, About 115 Flights Will Be Cut
content: Hours after he warned of exemplary action against IndiGo for the recent chaos at airports, Union Civil Aviation Minister K Ram Mohan Naidu has said the airline's winter flight schedule will be curtailed and its slots given to other operators

title: Seepu, Sherry, Daljot: Bishnoi Nexus Behind Attacks on Kapil Sharma's Cafe
content: In a major development, Delhi Police have identified the two shooters involved in the recent firing incidents at actor-comedian Kapil Sharma's restaurant in Canada.

title: Officers Deployed At 10 Major Airports For Inspection Amid Indigo Crisis
content: Amid widespread disruptions at several airports due to the ongoing operational crisis at Indigo, the Ministry of Civil Aviation has directed senior officers to conduct on-ground inspections at major airports across the country.

title: Nagpur Kabbadi Player Dies By Suicide. Was Upset Husband Didn't Get Her Promised Job
content: A kabaddi player in Maharashtra's Nagpur has allegedly died by suicide after her husband didn't get her a job he promised her before getting married.

title: Swish Restaurateurs To Fugitives: How Goa Fire Singed Luthra Brothers
content: For nine years, brothers Saurabh Luthra and Gaurav Luthra from Delhi's Kingsway Camp opened multiple cafes and clubs, first in Delhi and then in several major cities, including Goa

title: Malayalam Director And Ex-MLA Accused Of Molestation By Colleague, Case Filed
content: The woman, in her complaint, said that Muhammed - who was serving as the jury chairman - entered her room and assaulted her.

title: China Court Orders Malaysia Airlines To Pay Rs 4 Crore To Each MH370 Family
content: A Beijing court has ruled that Malaysia Airlines must pay 2.9 million yuan ($410,000) each to the families of eight passengers who went missing in the mysterious disappearance of the MH370 flight more than a decade ago.

title: Fertilizer Crisis Deepens As 2 Madhya Pradesh Farmers Die Waiting In Line
content: A severe fertilizer shortage across Madhya Pradesh has pushed farmers to desperation, resulting in two tragic deaths within two weeks and triggering widespread protests, road blockades, and political confrontation.

title: Indians Can Now Get Australian PR With Zero Money, Zero Job Offer, And It's 100% Real
content: The process involves submitting an Expression of Interest, collecting proof of achievements, securing a nominator, and passing a merit-based evaluation. If selected, applicants are granted immediate permanent residency.

title: PM Modi Greets Sonia Gandhi On Her 79th Birthday
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday greeted Sonia Gandhi, the leader of the Congress Party in Parliament, on her birthday, wishing her good health.

title: Why Is Sensex Down Today: Global Jitters, Rupee Shock And Foreign Exits
content: Markets are bracing for the Federal Reserves December 10 policy outcome, a pivotal moment for global investors. While a 25-basis-point rate cut is widely expected, traders are on edge about the possibility of a surprise hold.

title: This Mutual Fund Number Looks Small But Could Ruin Your Retirement Returns
content: A 0.5 percent cut in expense ratio can increase a Rs 10 lakh SIP's final corpus by roughly Rs 2 lakh over 20 years, solely due to reduced compounding costs.

title: Goa Club Owners May Get Interpol's Blue Corner Notice: What Are Colour-Coded Alerts
content: The Luthra brothers flew from Mumbai to Phuket at 5:30 am on Sunday, hours after the tragedy at the Goa nightclub.

title: "India Shouldn't Be In Delusion": Asim Munir's New Provocation As Pakistan's Defence Chief
content: Pakistan's newly appointed Chief of Defence Forces (CDF), Field Marshal Asim Munir, has issued yet another unwarranted provocation against India, warning of an even more "swift, severe, and intense" response in the event of any future aggression.

title: Madhya Pradesh Minister's Brother Arrested For Smuggling Ganja: Cops
content: The police recovered 46 kg of marijuana from Anil Bagri, the brother of Minister of State Pratima Bagri.

title: Lok Sabha To Take Up Electoral Reforms Today, 10-Hour Debate Scheduled
content: Electoral reforms will be at the centre of an extended and politically charged debate in the Lok Sabha today as the House sets aside 10 hours for a detailed discussion during the Winter Session of Parliament.

title: Interpol Notice Likely Against Goa Club Owners Who Fled To Thailand: Sources
content: The Blue Corner notice, an international request, is a part of Interpol's colour-coded notices that enable countries to share alerts and requests for information worldwide.

title: Actor-Politician Vijay's First Rally Since Karur Stampede Today, Venue Puducherry
content: Actor-politician Vijay is all set to address his first public meeting in Puducherry on Tuesday, speaking from the rooftop of his campaign bus in what his party, the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam, insists is a standalone gathering and not a roadshow.

title: UK Politician Fined For Hiring Indian Student As Nanny Illegally
content: A local Labour Party politician from west London has been fined 40,000 pounds after she lost an appeal against an immigration law breach for hiring an Indian student as a nanny illegally.

title: 'Rules are good but ... ': PM weighs in on IndiGo chaos; stresses people must not face trouble
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi stressed that rules must aid, not harass the public, amidst IndiGo's ongoing flight crisis. The airline's operational issues stem from new pilot rest rules, impacting thousands of passengers. Union minister Kiren Rijiju conveyed the PM's concern, emphasising passenger convenience and urging MPs to focus on public-centric reforms.

title: DGCA cuts IndiGo flight schedules by 5%; 115 daily flights reduced — what it means
content: The aviation regulator DGCA has reduced IndiGo's flights by five percent. This decision follows a period of significant flight cancellations. IndiGo's operations were impacted by new pilot duty rules and an increase in flights. Other airlines saw minor adjustments to their schedules. Aviation authorities are reviewing the situation.

title: 'Bacchey bade ho jate hain': Wasim Akram takes dig at IPL duration, calls PSL No.1
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Wasim Akram sparked debate by suggesting the IPL's extended duration becomes monotonous, contrasting it with the Pakistan Super League's shorter, more appealing format for international players. He cited the Big Bash League's shift to a shorter window as evidence, emphasizing the PSL's bowling depth and competitive edge.

title: ICC media shake-up: JioStar plans exit; Sony Pictures, Netflix and Amazon emerge as contenders
content: JioStar reportedly seeks to exit its $3 billion ICC cricket media rights deal due to financial losses, leaving the governing body scrambling. The ICC is now seeking $2.4 billion for new rights, approaching Sony, Netflix, and Amazon, but interest is reportedly low amid a challenging sports media landscape.

title: ‘Desperate for a son’: Karnataka man chops wife’s hair; burns it in graveyard
content: A shocking incident unfolded in Vijayapura where a husband, desperate for a male heir, allegedly followed a sorceress's bizarre advice. He reportedly cut his wife's hair, causing a scalp injury, and then burnt it in a graveyard.

title: 'No other player like Hardik Pandya': Ex-batting coach says he unlocks India's best combination
content: India's T20 World Cup title defence receives a major boost with Hardik Pandya's return. Former coach Sanjay Bangar believes Pandya's unique all-round abilities are crucial for the team's balanced XI. Shubman Gill also returns after recovering from a neck spasm. Jitesh Sharma is tipped for the number seven spot. Pandya's availability allows for preferred spin options without compromising batting depth.

title: 'New science?' Kejriwal mocks CM Rekha Gupta’s ‘AQI is temperature’ remark
content: Aam Aadmi Party leader Arvind Kejriwal has questioned Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta's scientific basis for claims on air pollution, particularly her assertion that AQI is a type of temperature. Gupta defended water spraying at pollution hotspots as a solution, a practice she stated was also employed by previous governments.

title: Want to use your old smartphone as a home security camera? How to set it up
content: Transform your old smartphone into a home security camera with a simple app. This cost-effective DIY solution allows you to monitor your home, children, or pets remotely. By installing a security app on your old phone and your current device, you can set up a functional surveillance system. While convenient, be aware of limitations compared to professional cameras.

title: 'You start your innings on zero': Smriti Mandhana's comment goes viral
content: Smriti Mandhana's past interview on dealing with setbacks has resurfaced following the announcement that her wedding to Palash Muchhal has been called off. In the clip, she shared her strategy of focusing on short-term goals and routine to overcome difficult phases.

title: Luthra brothers flee to Thailand: Goa police issue blue corner notice
content: Goa police have issued a blue corner notice for nightclub owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, who fled to Thailand shortly after a fire incident. The brothers reportedly left Delhi for Phuket just hours after the blaze, indicating an attempt to evade authorities.  Authorities are coordinating with Interpol for their swift apprehension.

title: Sherry and Daljot: Shooters behind attack on Kapil Sharma's Kap's Café revealed; duo linked to Bishnoi gang, Seepu gave orders
content: Central agencies and Canadian police are actively searching for Sharry and Diljot Rehal, two alleged shooters linked to the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. The duo is accused of carrying out multiple firing incidents at comedian Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe in Surrey and Mumbai. Investigations reveal a mastermind, Seepu, orchestrated these attacks, with an arrested associate providing logistical support.

title: Reddit outage: Thousands of users unable to access app and website
content: Reddit experienced a major outage on December 9, impacting thousands of users globally.  Reports indicate a significant percentage of users were unable to access the website, with others facing server connection issues or app inaccessibility. This disruption has led to user frustration and speculation about infrastructure upgrades.

title: 'They can't do that': New tariffs amid trade talks? Trump asks why India is 'allowed to dump rice in US'
content: US President Donald Trump has signaled potential new tariffs on Indian rice imports, questioning why New Delhi faces no additional duties. This comes as he announced a $12 billion aid package for American farmers struggling with falling prices and import competition. The move adds a fresh trade friction point ahead of upcoming bilateral talks.

title: Prem Chopra’s health update: Actor treated for severe Aortic Stenosis with TAVI procedure
content: Veteran actor Prem Chopra, known for his villainous roles, has successfully recovered after undergoing a TAVI procedure for severe Aortic Stenosis. His son-in-law, Sharman Joshi, shared the encouraging update, thanking the doctors for their expertise. Prem Chopra is now back home and feeling much better, much to the relief of his fans.

title: IND vs SA: India’s final run before T20 WC starts; SKY leads squad tune-up mission
content: Team India gears up for the T20 World Cup with a five-match series against South Africa, marking the return of key players Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya. Suryakumar Yadav's team aims to fine-tune their champion squad, while South Africa welcome back Anrich Nortje. The Barabati Stadium pitch is expected to favour batters, promising a run-fest.

title: 'Mohabbat ki dukaan a farce': BJP targets Cong after action on anti-Revanth Reddy poster
content: The BJP has sharply criticised Telangana CM Revanth Reddy, accusing the Congress government of failing to fulfill poll promises and resorting to authoritarianism. The party alleged arrests followed a social media poster criticising the CM's "two-year failure," highlighting corruption and misgovernance. Congress defended its record, citing financial challenges and commitment to guarantees.

title: Hidden causes of pedal oedema in swollen feet and ankles
content: Pedal oedema, the abnormal swelling of feet and ankles, signals underlying conditions like heart failure, liver cirrhosis, kidney disorders, or venous issues. Fluid accumulation occurs due to disrupted fluid balance, requiring medical evaluation to identify the root cause and manage symptoms effectively. Early recognition and treatment are crucial to prevent complications.

title: SIR showdown: UP man returns home after 36 years for documents; family refuses to recognise
content: A monk, Sarvesh Sachan, sought police help in Kanpur after his family refused to recognize him and withheld his academic documents.  He had left home 36 years ago to become a monk.  Police verified his identity and allowed him to collect his marksheet for the SIR exercise, resolving the unusual family dispute.

title: 'Don't share screen space with Salman': Bhojpuri star Pawan Singh gets threats; files complaint
content: Bhojpuri actor Pawan Singh has reportedly received threats from individuals claiming affiliation with the Lawrence Bishnoi gang.  These anonymous callers warned Singh against sharing a stage with Salman Khan, with his manager filing a police complaint.  The threats, which also involve demands for money, have prompted a request for police protection.

title: UP cop raped at gunpoint by brother-in-law; given medicines for male child
content: A Pilibhit constable accused her husband and six relatives of torture for an SUV dowry, forcing her to drink sanitiser, and repeated molestation. An FIR was lodged, charging the husband, his parents, and two brothers with cruelty and other offenses. The woman also alleged rape at gunpoint and forced medication during pregnancy.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are prices headed this week and should you 'buy on dips'?
content: Gold price prediction: Gold prices are poised for an upward trend driven by positive global signals. Investors are advised to adopt a 'buy on dips' strategy.  China's central bank continues its gold buying spree, boosting reserves.  Silver ETFs are also seeing significant inflows, indicating strong investor interest.  The Federal Reserve's upcoming monetary policy decision will be a key event to watch.

title: Anna Kournikova and Enrique Iglesias combined net worth in 2025
content: Tennis star Anna Kournikova and music icon Enrique Iglesias boast a combined net worth of $160 million in 2025. While Kournikova's fame transcended her $4 million prize money through lucrative endorsements, Iglesias' wealth stems from over 130 million record sales and global tours. Both have strategically invested in Miami real estate, contributing to their substantial shared fortune.

title: Gracie Hunt stuns with runway-ready style in intense mint training session
content: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt showcases her fitness journey, blending athlete-level intensity with stylish presentation in her latest Instagram workout. The 26-year-old influencer demonstrated a full-body circuit, highlighting her strength, discipline, and ability to make workouts visually engaging. Her posts inspire followers by proving fitness can be both fierce and fun, reflecting her mission beyond her family name.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 falls below 25,800; BSE Sensex tanks over 600 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in opening trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 went below 25,800, BSE Sensex was down over 620 points.

title: Massive earthquake hits Japan: Viral videos show panic, chaos; 'megaquake' alert issued
content: A powerful 7.5 magnitude earthquake jolted northern Japan, causing widespread fear and damage. Tsunami waves, power outages, and evacuations followed the tremor. Authorities reported numerous injuries and infrastructure damage. A 'megaquake' alert has been issued, warning of potential larger seismic activity in the coming week, reminding residents of the 2011 disaster.

title: IndiGo meltdown: Senior officers to conduct on-ground inspection at 10 airports
content: Senior officials are inspecting major airports to assess passenger issues caused by IndiGo's operational problems. The airline's schedule will be cut by five percent, impacting 110 daily flights. The Ministry and DGCA are monitoring the situation closely. IndiGo's internal crew rostering and operational planning are cited as reasons for the disruptions. Safety standards remain paramount.

title: Ovarian cancer: Experts explain symptoms and signs behind menstrual cramps
content: Ovarian cancer, often a "silent killer," is the 8th most common cancer in women globally and the third in India. Early symptoms like persistent bloating, pelvic heaviness, appetite changes, urinary urgency, and menstrual irregularities are often mistaken for common issues. If these symptoms persist for over a few weeks, seeking medical attention is crucial for early detection and better outcomes.

title: 'Absolutely filthy' - Ashwin explains why Indian players can't speak like Nathan Lyon
content: Australian spinner Nathan Lyon's candid admission of being "filthy" after being dropped sparked a debate on Indian cricketers' reserved reactions. Veteran R Ashwin revealed that while emotions are similar, Indian players fear "collateral damage" and being labelled for expressing themselves, unlike in some Western cultures. He hopes this will change.

title: Hyderabad horror: Businessman hacked, bludgeoned with stones, shot dead
content: A 45-year-old Hyderabad businessman, Venkat Ratnam, was brutally murdered in broad daylight by six assailants. The shocking incident, captured on CCTV, involved a vehicle ramming his bike, followed by a savage attack with knives and stones, culminating in a gunshot. Police are investigating past associations for potential motives.

title: Non-Muslim foreign residents can enjoy alcohol in Saudi Arabia - but there is one condition
content: Saudi Arabia is now permitting non-Muslim foreign residents to purchase alcohol.  A monthly income exceeding 50,000 riyals is the sole requirement.  This move aims to attract skilled expatriates and boost tourism revenue.  The kingdom seeks to diversify its economy beyond oil.  This policy shift is being implemented cautiously, with no official public statements.

title: Serena and Venus Williams’ combined 2025 net worth - careers and businesses explored
content: Tennis titans Serena and Venus Williams boast a combined net worth of approximately $440-445 million by 2025. Their immense wealth stems from significant prize money, lucrative endorsements with major brands, and successful business ventures including investment firms and fashion lines. Both sisters continue to be active forces in sports and business.

title: Meet Neal Mohan — Indian-origin executive named Time’s 2025 CEO of the Year
content: YouTube CEO Neal Mohan, an Indian-origin executive, has been named TIME's 2025 CEO of the Year. TIME recognized Mohan for his role in shaping YouTube into a dominant force in global cultural consumption. His leadership at the video giant stems from a strong academic background and extensive experience in digital advertising and product development.

title: Akshaye Khanna’s Rs 167cr net worth: Inside his luxurious homes and car collection
content: Akshaye Khanna is captivating audiences with his powerful performance in 'Dhurandhar', particularly his viral entry scene.  The actor, son of Vinod Khanna, has built a successful career with notable films.  His estimated net worth stands at Rs 167 crore, bolstered by prime Mumbai real estate and a collection of luxury vehicles, reflecting a discreet yet affluent lifestyle.

title: George Springer’s fairytale life with wife Charlise Castro, who built her own path
content: Charlise Castro, a former Division I softball standout and America East Player of the Year, forged her own path beyond being George Springer's wife. After excelling in athletics, she pursued an MBA and built a credible career in wellness coaching, demonstrating ambition and resilience. Her journey highlights how partners of elite athletes can cultivate independent identities and success.

title: IPL auction: Not 1355 — only 350 players will go under the hammer on December 16
content: Among the 35 new additions to the final list, South African wicketkeeper-batter Quinton de Kock stands out as a surprise entry. De Kock was not part of the original document but was later included following a recommendation from a franchise. His addition comes soon after he reversed his international retirement and scored a century in the ODI against India in Visakhapatnam.

title: Indian-origin man charged with murder in California; was driving Tesla at 150mph
content: An Indian-origin man, Badal Dholaria, faces murder charges after allegedly driving his Tesla at over 150 mph while drunk, causing a fatal collision. The crash killed 41-year-old Alix Mari Sparks. Dholaria, who sustained only minor injuries, has pleaded not guilty to multiple felony DUI counts. Investigators found .08% blood alcohol content.

title: Gabrielle Union breaks silence on Dwyane Wade relationship amid child scandal
content: Gabrielle Union has opened up about the devastation she felt when Dwyane Wade fathered a child with another woman during a brief breakup in 2013. Despite the trauma, the couple worked through the issue, with Wade admitting their marriage isn't perfect and requires ongoing effort. They reunited and married in 2014.

title: Kerala rape-abduction case verdict: Actor Dileep cleared of all charges
content: A Kerala court acquitted Malayalam actor Dileep in the 2017 abduction and rape case, finding insufficient proof of his conspiracy. The six-member gang that carried out the assault, led by Pulsar Suni, was convicted of gang rape and other charges, with sentencing set for December 12.

title: ‘Dhurandhar’ Day 4: Ranveer Singh’s film beats lifetime numbers of ‘Ram-Leela’
content: Ranveer Singh's latest film, 'Dhurandhar,' is a box office sensation, raking in ₹126 crore in its first four days. Inspired by true events, the Aditya Dhar directorial has surpassed the lifetime earnings of 'Goliyon Ki Rasleela Ram-Leela.' The movie has already become Singh's highest opener and the second-highest opener of 2025, solidifying its place as a major hit.

title: More funding for Pakistan! IMF gives green signal to $1.2 billion tranche
content: The IMF approved a $1.2 billion disbursement to Pakistan, bringing total inflows to $3.3 billion, acknowledging the country's reform efforts despite recent flood shocks. This funding supports macroeconomic stability and climate resilience, with further reforms needed for private sector-led growth and fiscal resilience.

title: Congress betrayed national song under pressure from Jinnah: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi accused the Congress of betraying 'Vande Mataram' under pressure from Mohammed Ali Jinnah, citing appeasement politics. He highlighted Mahatma Gandhi's praise for the song, noting its significance as a unifying force against British rule. Modi criticized the Congress's 1937 decision to limit the song's recital, linking it to the eventual division of India.

title: China must assure us our citizens won't be harassed: India
content: India has demanded assurances from China that its citizens won't face selective harassment after an Arunachal Pradesh resident was reportedly mistreated at Shanghai airport. New Delhi strongly protested the incident, reaffirming Arunachal's status as an integral part of India. The MEA advised Indian nationals to exercise caution when traveling to or transiting through China.

title: AI171 crash: US lawyer Mike Andrews seeks probe into tech glitch; meets victims’ families
content: Aviation lawyer Mike Andrews, representing families of over 130 victims of the AI 171 crash, is in Ahmedabad urging a thorough investigation into a possible technical glitch. He noted the AAIB's meeting with the NTSB as encouraging, suggesting significant findings. Andrews highlighted concerns about a known coupling issue potentially causing electrical problems, evidenced by survivor accounts of flickering lights.

title: Wedding called off: 'Calm isn't silence' – Smriti Mandhana’s latest post goes viral
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana has officially called off her wedding with composer Palash Muchhal, requesting privacy for both families.  While the exact reasons remain undisclosed, Mandhana emphasised her commitment to representing India.  This follows an earlier postponement due to a family health emergency.  She seeks to focus on her career.

title: Japan earthquake: 23 injured after magnitude 7.5 quake; tsunami warning lifted
content: A powerful magnitude 7.5 earthquake struck off northern Japan, triggering a tsunami that hit Pacific coast communities and injured at least 23 people. Authorities warned of possible aftershocks and an increased risk of a megaquake, urging residents to remain prepared for potential evacuations.

title: 'Birds aren't real': Chargers poke fun at Eagles after win, topping NFL Week 14 trolls
content: the Chargers beat the Philadelphia Eagles 22-19 in overtime . the team had multiple virtual jabs on deck after its huge victory . they referenced the "positivity rabbit" installed in the Eagles locker room last week .

title: Wishes pour in as Sonia Gandhi turns 79
content: Sonia Gandhi, the longest serving Congress president, has taken a back seat from active politics in the last few years due to health reasons

title: 'Vande Mataram' row: Congress cites historian's remarks referring to Tagore's advice on song, slams PM
content: Sugata Bose, in a video, said that it was on Tagore's advice that the Congress decided that at national meetings only the first part of the Vande Mataram song would be performed

title: Karnataka High Court stays government’s order mandating one-day monthly menstrual leave for women employees
content: Petitioners said that there exists no provision in the concerned statutes to grant leave during menstrual cycle and hence the government had no power to introduce additional leave through a notification.

title: Kerala local body polls: A.K. Antony points to anti-incumbency sentiment, suggests even Left voters seek change
content: Speaking after casting his vote, Antony says ‘even Left-leaning voters are wishing for a shock treatment to the Left’

title: TVK chief Vijay’s public meeting in Puducherry begins amid strict crowd control measures
content: Mr. Vijay, who reached Puducherry on Monday (December 8) night, arrived at the venue in his campaign vehicle at around 10.30 a.m.

title: Supreme Court hearing on SIR LIVE: Tamil Nadu seeks extension of enumeration forms phase
content: The petitioner side challenging the constitutionality of the SIR exercise claimed that the Election Commission has morphed into a “despot” that has transformed a “suspicion” about the purity of the electoral roll into a massive countrywide survey

title: Marathon Day of engagements for CM Revanth as the Telangana Rising Global Summit concludes
content: Focus on education, power, life sciences, food processing, automobiles, electronics and AI; Vision Document to be unveiled this evening

title: Dileep’s acquittal in Kerala actor rape case echoes in poll-day chatter
content: UDF convenor Adoor Prakash reignited the debate centring on trial court’s decision to acquit Dileep of conspiracy charges, alleging that Kerala government was seeking to ‘further victimise’ the actor by deciding to appeal the verdict in High Court

title: NTR Jr. moves Delhi HC for protection of personality rights
content: The actor’s lawyer submitted that NTR Jr.’s personality rights were being violated with the circulation of several materials on social media platforms and e-commerce sites

title: Cluster-level federations of women’s SHGs promoting rural entrepreneurship in Rajasthan
content: Chief Secretary Srinivas interacted with the women entrepreneurs engaged in the blue pottery craft and the traditional hand block printing on cotton fabrics

title: New feature to identify duplicate voters launched on BLO apps in West Bengal
content: At least 56 lakh voters have been identified as “dead, duplicate, untraceable and shifted” in the State till now

title: Kerala local body polls: Fronts make fervent bid to sway electoral outcome on the day of ‘silent campaigning’
content: “Silent campaigning” unfolded across three Municipal Corporations, 39 municipalities, seven district panchayats, 75 block panchayats, and 471 grama panchayats spread over Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam, Idukki, Alappuzha, and Ernakulam districts.

title: Kerala local body polls: LDF–UDF locked in a neck-and-neck battle in Thrissur; BJP could tilt the scales
content: With an unpredictable electorate and shifting community votes, the district braces for a razor-thin verdict.

title: LDF vies for a coup in a district perceived a UDF bastion
content: Landslide rehabilitation remains the central electoral issue, extending beyond the three wards in Meppadi grama panchayat that have been directly affected. Allegations against both main fronts have become campaign flash-points

title: Kerala local body polls: Neck-and-neck fight in Palakkad as BJP, UDF, LDF vie for 53 seats
content: Rivalry within the BJP has reached a boiling point, and the party will not be surprised to lose a few seats. In the case of the Congress, while it insists that its house is intact and stronger than last year, concerns linger that the Rahul Mamkootathil issue can hurt its prospects. Meanwhile, the CPI(M) appears stagnant in Palakkad

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: Catholic Church says will support candidates who address people’s issues
content: The Church is not biased towards any political front in the State, says Idukki diocese media commission director

title: Kerala local body polls: BJP candidate R. Sreelekha shares pre-polls survey, courts controversy
content: General Education Minister V. Sivankutty said that Ms. Sreelekha’s action is a violation of the model code of conduct

title: Police question Chinese national for second day, as low-budget homestays come under scanner in Srinagar
content: Security agencies were following his digital footprint in Kashmir and Ladakh, where he toured recently. He had managed to procure a SIM card, “which is being investigated”, officials said.

title: Kerala local body polls: V.D. Satheesan predicts landslide for UDF, cites anti‑incumbency and Sabarimala gold theft row
content: While the pattern of elections to the local bodies, Parliament, and the Assembly is different, there will indeed be signs of what to expect in the Assembly elections from this poll, he says

title: ED files prosecution complaint against Satyendar Jain, 13 others in DJB case
content: On December 4, in the same case, the agency attached assets worth about ₹15.36 crore of various persons.

title: Goa fire tragedy: Flagged illegalities about nightclub for years, says landowner
content: Birch by Romeo Lane, a popular party venue in Arpora village in North Goa, turned into a death trap on December 7 as a massive fire tore through the premises, killing 25 people, most of them staff and a few tourists

title: Parliament Winter session Day 7 LIVE: Left Wing Extremism will be eliminated by March 31, 2026, says Nityanand Rai in Lok Sabha
content: Lok Sabha to take up discussion on election reforms; the Rajya Sabha is expected to continue with the discussion on the 150th Anniversary of the National Song “Vande Mataram”

title: India's Tata signs up Intel as first major customer for $14 billion chip foray
content: The electronics-manufacturing arm of the 156-year-old salt-to-software Tata group is investing about $14 billion

title: Census 2027: Registrar General of India asks States to appoint census functionaries by January 15, 2026
content: During the 2027 census, about 30 lakh field functionaries will be deployed to complete the task of taking the population count across the country within a fixed time frame

title: 58 IndiGo flight cancellations at Hyderabad airport on December 9
content: The airline cancelled 14 arrivals and 44 departures, marking the first occasion since December 4 that the daily tally of cancellations has fallen below 100

title: DGCA mulls 5% curtailment of IndiGo flights amid operational review
content: The regulator has asked the airline to assess the potential impact on its routes and flight schedules before a final decision is taken, a senior government official told The Hindu

title: Kerala local body polls: Polling for first phase under way in seven districts
content: Voters in Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam, Idukki and Ernakulam will cast their ballots today

title: Trump threatens tariffs on Indian rice, but trade metrics show pain will be felt by the U.S.
content: The U.S. accounts for about 3% of Indian rice exports, but Indian rice comprises about 26% of U.S. rice imports

title: After years of flood risk, Varadharajapuram residents hope for safer monsoons with new projects
content: The panchayat was one of the prominent residential neighbourhoods developed in the 1970s, with more than 70 different layouts; it now has many vacant plots, as the flood risk has prevented owners from building homes

title: Denmark envoy to India calls on T.N. CM Stalin
content: In another event, the recently reconstituted Backward Classes Commission’s chairperson and retired High Court judge V. Bharathidasan and members called on the Chief Minister in the Secretariat

title: Mamata says BJP leaders not aware of Bengal icons as Parliament discusses Vande Mataram
content: The Trinamool Congress took an offence to Prime Minister Narendra Modi referring Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay as Bankim da and said that “BJP is utterly alien to Bengal’s way of life”

title: MP Engineer Rashid seeks PM intervention ‘to end growing disconnect between L-G, CM’ in J&K
content: In the letter, the parliamentarian from the Baramulla Lok Sabha pointed out that the situation has started to create uncertainty among citizens and has slowed down decision-making on key developmental and welfare matters.

title: 🏈 CFP to Pop-Tarts: Picking every bowl game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: Man City have history of overtaking Arsenal; will it happen again?
content: pep Guardiola has revealed that their 3-0 win over sunderland was their best performance of the season . the gunners are two points clear of city at the top of the premier league table . aston villa are one point further back in third place following their 2-1 win against arsenal on sunday .

title: These five players could help decide unpredictable East
content: the Eastern Conference is as unpredictable as any point in recent history . the upstart Detroit Pistons sit atop the standings at the quarter mark . it's too early to predict the contenders that will match up for conference supremacy in spring .

title: Women: UConn stays top, Big Ten has nine spots
content: the new AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the top 10 remained the same . Nebraska cornhuskers joined the poll, replacing the west Virginia Mountaineers . a weekend when the no. 1 team lost in college football and men's basketball, the Huskies easily avoided the upset bug .

title: First round first look: How all eight teams can win
content: the college football playoff selection committee's final top 25 of the season produced a 12-team bracket that includes two regular-season rematches in the first round . no. 9 Alabama at No. 8 Oklahoma and no. 11 Tulane at no. 6 Ole Miss beat Alabama, 23-21, on Nov. 15 . the ACC's best team will have a chance to compete for the national title when no. 10 Miami travels to no. 7 Texas A&M .

title: A great night for Jeff Kent, but another stain on the Hall of Fame
content: the contemporary baseball era committee's Hall of Fame ballot announced Sunday night . if not for Barry Bonds, Jeff Kent might not be bound for Cooperstown . Kent was on the same ballot as Bonds -- who hit more homers than anyone, at any position .

title: Indian man found guilty of 2018 murder in Australia; cut victim's throat as her dog barked
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: SIR work being 'hindered': SC takes note of BLOs being threatened; asks EC to 'deal with situation'
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: Chhattisgarh govt amends provisions on land valuation guidelines amid Opposition backlash
content: A good government is one that occasionally amends its decisions in the public interest. Certainly, there are some concerns regarding the guideline rates; they are being reviewed, says Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai

title: Renowned socialist leader Baba Adhav, 95, passes away
content: He had fought against caste system and for the rights of labourers, head-loaders, waste-pickers, and street vendors

title: SC relaxes former T.N. Minister Senthilbalaji’s bail conditions
content: He had a weekly-twice obligation to appear before the Directorate of Enforcement officer investigating a money-laundering case linked to the cash-for-jobs scam

title: Support for BJP rose in Madurai district in 2024 Lok Sabha election, compared with 2016 Assembly election
content: In 2016 Assembly poll, it contested in all seats but Madurai North, securing a single-digit vote share in all others except Madurai  South. In 2024, its vote share exceeded 20% in 5 Assembly segments

title: 13,989 pilots employed by six major domestic airlines: Govt
content: MoS Civil Aviation Murlidhar Mohol said the rationale behind airlines hiring foreign pilots, inter alia, is the requirement of a specific type-rated pilot in light of fleet expansions and time-bound operational requirements.

title: Highways Department takes up repairs on roads damaged during Cyclone Ditwah in Chennai
content: Of the 654 km of roads under the department’s control in the city, potholes have developed on 109 km of the carriageway. Of this, repairs on 89 km has been completed

title: City Union Bank, SalarySe partner up for a credit card exclusively for salaried employees
content: The Level Up Credit Card introduces India's first ‘Salary Day Bonus’ feature, offering up to 37.5% rewards on salary disbursement days, enabling salaried employees to maximize returns on essential expenses coinciding with payroll cycles

title: Goa nightclub fire: Owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra fled to Phuket after tragedy, say police
content: The Bureau of Immigration at Mumbai was contacted, and it was found that both the accused had taken the 6E 1073 flight to Phuket at 5:30 a.m. on December 7, immediately after the fire incident, which occurred around midnight, the officer said

title: Government, Opposition spar in Lok Sabha over Vande Mataram
content: PM Modi charges Nehru with betraying the National Song for Jinnah; Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra questions the need for debate on Vande Mataram that is a part of India’s soul, accuses the government of doing it with eye on Bengal polls

title: Fire count gives a skewed picture of stubble burning: study
content: A research outfiit, iForest, studied multiple satellite datasets that said while government claims over a 90% reduction in Punjab and Haryana, burnt-area measurements show only a 30% decline

title: Kannada and Hindi to enter NLSIU’s curriculum from 2026
content: The move aims to develop a multilingual imagination in students, encouraging them to think, speak, and write across languages, and to engage with the cultural contexts that shape them

title: INDIA bloc plans to move a motion to impeach Madras High Court Judge G.R. Swaminathan
content: The judge last week directed the authorities of the Subramaniya  Swamy Temple at Thirupparankundram to ensure that the  Karthigai Deepam was lit at the deepathoon  (pillar) near a dargah atop the hill

title: IndiGo seeks more time to reply to show-cause notices
content: The airline says it is “not realistically possible to pinpoint the exact causes” of widespread disruptions in flight operations; flight cancellations down to 500 from 1,500 on December 5

title: Trainer aircraft crashes after hitting a power line while landing
content: "Pilot Ajit Chavda and another occupant were injured. They were rescued by power company staff, villagers, and police. The two are undergoing treatment at a private hospital in Barapathar, and both are out of danger," says an official

title: India will overtake China to emerge as second large Construction Equipment player by 2030
content: CII to host 13th edition of EXCON 2025, South Asia’s Construction Equipment Exhibition between December 9 to 13 at the Bangalore International Exhibition Centre

title: Pedestrian deaths account for 37% of road accident fatalities in Coimbatore
content: Of the 232 persons who lost their lives in road traffic accidents in the city from January to October, 86 were pedestrians

title: Schedule changes, glitches, new rules among causes of disruptions, says IndiGo
content: The airline is "profusely apologetic" and deeply regrets the inconvenience and hardship caused to customers following flight cancellations, Civil Aviation Regulator DGCA said.

title: Centre’s blunder caused Indigo’s flight cancellations ‘disaster’, says Mamata Banerjee
content: The Trinamool Congress chairperson said that she will request the Centre to make some plan so that at least half the flights are operational.

title: HR Conclave to be held at Guru Nanak College on December 10
content: The event is being conducted to expose students to the present-day industry demands and workplace scenarios

title: Opposition slams BJP, says National Song was used to unite people during freedom struggle
content: Trinamool Congress member Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar said Vande Mataram was not only India’s National Song but also a legacy that millions sang to fuel the struggle for Independence.

title: Former Maharashtra CM Chavan warns of aviation monopoly, seeks breakup of IndiGo
content: Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan says IndiGo’s dominance and Tata Group’s growing share threaten competition; urges government to split carrier and revive national airline

title: Naidu urges linguists to coin new words in Telugu language
content: The change in the language is inevitable due to changes in everyday life, culture and traditions, said Nannaya University Vice-Chancellor Prof.S.Prasanna Sree

title: Top CPI (Maoist) leader, 11 others surrender in Chhattisgarh
content: Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai said that in the past two years, over 4,000 Maoists had either surrendered or were killed by the security forces in Chhattisgarh

title: ED is a ‘wrongdoer’ which conducted illegal searches and fabricated T.N. govt. logo, State tells Madras High Court
content: T.N. says the central agency had misrepresented and concealed vital facts in a writ petition seeking a direction to State police to register FIRs on the basis of info shared regarding sand mining offences

title: India ramps up humanitarian efforts in Sri Lanka under Operation Sagar Bandhu
content: Earlier, INS Vikrant, INS Udaygiri and INS Sukanya had extended critical support, including relief supplies and heli-borne search and rescue operations.
